result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnnie C Roby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to count 2 and any other; credit for 5 days (2-17-2015 to 02-21-2015).

miscConds.notes:
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  Fine is set at ZERO.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
No contact with any known illegal drug user.
No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
No contact with Remone R. (DOB 01-31-1986).

Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

timeConds.notes: COUNT 1 ONLY: Without good time credit; release for The Day Reporting Center, work, and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnnie C Roby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnnie C Roby not in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

Defendant Johnnie C Roby in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to count 2 and any other; credit for 5 days (2-17-2015 to 02-21-2015).
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
- Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center, work, and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
AS TO COUNT 2-
Court ordered defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 0 days. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety:  No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Seek/ Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user.
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- No contact with Remone R. (DOB 01-31-1986).
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated June 5, 2015 received and filed. tk
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report: MIssed Office Contact. received and filed. tk

Defendant Johnnie C Roby in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
State motions to withdraw amended information filed on May 11, 2015. Court orders amended information filed on 5-11-2015 withdrawn. 
AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2: On motion of the State, Court ordered penalty enhancer dismissed.
AS TO COUNT  1 and 2  - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Jury trial on 06-03-2015 is vacated. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Closing arugments heard

DECISION: Court finds the stop and search were justified

Amended Information filed - not addressed this date.

Defense request for a plea date / adjourned final pretrial date is granted by the court.      Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 17  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report dated 05-08-15 received and filed
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report re: Drug Test - Positive, received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report re: Drug Test- Positive, received and filed. No action taken at this time.

Defendant Johnnie C Roby in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel requests case be set for Motion Hearing, Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Motion Hearing and Final Pretrial Conference on 5-11-2015 at 1:30 p.m. and Jury Trial on 6-3-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17. Any motions are due no later than 4-13-2015 by 5:00 p.m., and any response is due no later than 5-4-2015 by 5:00 p.m.  Calendar call scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated March 18, 2015, received and filed.
Original PRELIMINARY HEARING Transcript (14 pages) commencing MARCH 3, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Johnnie C Roby in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Ron Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #06CM2308 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Steven Jegen-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 03/02/2015.
HMP

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Johnnie C Roby in court with attorney Alexis B Luster.  Defendant Johnnie C Roby in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
